entry.summary: Mesh, a US-based fintech company specializing in integrations with over 300 leading exchanges and wallets, and Conio, the Italian fintech backed by Poste Italiane and Banca Generali, announced the launch of Europe‚Äôs first Open Banking solution for Bitcoin. Open Banking for Bitcoin This integration, hosted on Conio‚Äôs platform, offers streamlined access to the entire crypto ecosystem for its 430,000+ customers in Italy. Users can now seamlessly link their Bitcoin wallets with prominent digital asset exchange platforms. The collaboration leverages Mesh's capabilities to directly connect Conio's app with ten major platforms, including Binance, Coinbase, and Kraken, with more to follow in the coming weeks. entry.title: German Government Moves Millions More in Bitcoin to Exchanges
entry.summary:
The German Federal Criminal Police Office (BKA) on Monday transferred an additional 1,500 Bitcoin, valued at nearly $95 million, to multiple crypto exchanges, including Bitstamp, Coinbase, and Kraken.¬†
JUST IN: üá©üá™ German Government sends another 1,500 #Bitcoin worth $95 million to exchanges üëÄ pic.twitter.com/AZqs0UFWei ‚Äî Bitcoin Magazine (@BitcoinMagazine) July 1, 2024
This follows a series of transactions since June 19, where the German government has moved Bitcoin worth approximately $220 million to various exchanges, according to data from Arkham. The German government first acquired these Bitcoin after a large-scale seizure in 2013. The BKA confiscated almost 50,000 Bitcoin, then valued at over $2 billion, from the operators of Movie2k.to, a notorious film piracy website active during that period.¬† These movements suggest a potential intention by the German authorities to liquidate some of the Bitcoin in the crackdown. This move by Germany mirrors recent actions by the U.S. government, which also transferred millions of dollars in Bitcoin to exchanges, potentially signalling their intention to sell. In both cases, the transfers have sparked significant speculation within the Bitcoin community about the potential impact on Bitcoin's market price. Despite the substantial movements, most of the seized Bitcoin remains under the German government's control. Almost 44,692 Bitcoin, worth approximately $2.82 billion, are still held in government wallets. This means that the recent transfers, while notable, represent a relatively small portion of the total holdings. As the situation unfolds, how the Bitcoin market will react to these government-initiated movements remains to be seen.

entry.title: Spot Solana ETFs: Galaxy Digital Predicts Approval Odds By SEC
entry.summary:
Alex Thorn, Head of Research at Galaxy Digital, recently provided an analysis on the filings for spot Solana Exchange Traded Products (ETPs) by investment firms VanEck and 21Shares. These filings, made with the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) on June 28, represent an aggressive move to integrate Solana (SOL) into the structured framework of regulated financial markets, akin to those established for Bitcoin and Ethereum.
The proposal by VanEck, as outlined in their S-1 document, aims to launch a commodity-based trust that will hold Solana directly, thus allowing the ETP to track the asset‚Äôs market price closely. Unlike some crypto ETPs, this product will not engage in staking the held assets.
Following the announcement, the market responded positively, with SOL‚Äôs price marki‚Ä¶

JUP team proposes to reduce 30% of supply.

entry.title: This Robotics Company Aims to Solve a Labor Shortage in Manufacturing
entry.summary: GrayMatter Robotics Co-founder and CEO Ariyan Kabir explains the origin of the company, the need for artificial intelligence and robotics to offset a growing labor shortage, and takes Decrypt on a tour of its AI-powered facility.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 141 - SEC DROPS ETH PROBE
entry.summary: BTC: 65.4k (0%), ETH: 3545 (+3%), SOL: 139 (+2%). Top Gainers: LDO, BRETT, PEPE, AR. ETH & beta lead gains after SEC headline. SEC drops probe into ETH as a security. BTC ETFs see another $152m outflow. Pantera show $100m buying interest in ETH ETF. Pantera aims to raise new $1bn fund. Lack of staking won‚Äôt harm ETH ETF: 21 Shares. LayerZero airdrop coming June 20th. SEC concerns on USDC may delay Circle IPO. Hayes increasing PENDLE & DOGE positions. Fox News to build L2 with Polygon. EIGEN trades at $10bn pre-market. Drift & Ondo partner on RWAs. Commercial real estate coming on-chain: KPMG.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 140 - MARKETS DOWN BAD
entry.summary: BTC touches 1-month lows, dominance hits 56%. $500m of liquidations in fall, $146m ETF outflows. VanEck to launch first ETF in Australia. Coinbase to launch pre-market trading. 56% of Fortune 500 building in web3. Uphold to delist USDT in EU due to MiCA. TON flips DOGE in sell-off. Base DEX users now 2nd place after SOL. Ethena launches staking & restaking with Symbiotic. Lens aiming to raise $50m at $500m valuation. Two ‚Äòcrazy‚Äô MATIC announcements coming.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 139 - WHATS THE NEXT META?
entry.summary: BTC again breaks $66k, dominance rises. Fear & Greed index hits 3 month low. Whales continue to be in accumulation mode. Miners 33 days into capitulation, average 41 days. Financial advisors not buying BTC yet: BlackRock. Crypto funds saw $600m outflows last week. ZKsync airdrop live, prices at $5bn FDV. ZKsync defend sybil measures. Low float, high FDV coins get hammered again. Tether launches product backed by Gold. Korean exchanges reviewing 600 coins for delisting. ETH ETF ‚Äòsell the rumour, buy the news event‚Äô. BTC ETF basis buyers roughly 15% of demand. CVX bounces 100% after loan liquidation. TON sees fastest user growth in crypto history. APT may flip SOL in 1-3 years: Hayes. Crypto lifetime funding eclipses $100bn. SEC claims $876m Ripple fine still fair. Gensler could cost Biden election: Cuban.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 138 - MORE CELEB COINS!
entry.summary: Altcoins bleed out heavy, BTC dominance rises towards 60%. Miners continue to be large BTC sellers, whales accumulate. ETF inflows slow, hedge fund allocations point to basis trades. ETH ETFs approvals see little movement, coming 'in the summer‚Äô. Stocks continue to hit ATHs as CPI & PPI both come in soft. TON performs best in L1s, active wallets eclipse ETH. Andrew Tate joins celebrity memecoin meta, DADDY hits $350m. SOL DEX volumes eclipse ETH in memecoin frenzy. Curve founder defaults on CRV debt as DeFi coins tumble. Terraform Labs & Do Kwon to pay $4.5bn fine to SEC. BAMK hits $350m in Runes as it issues BTC stablecoin. Gaming tokens face huge sell-off, PRIME changes tokenomics.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 137 - CRYPTO DIPS FURTHER
entry.summary: Crypto falls after slightly hawkish Fed speech. BTC whales buy $1.4bn in 24hrs. Miners continue to be large sellers of BTC. BTC ETFs see $100m inflows. MicroStrategy to raise $500m to buy BTC. Egorov CRV debt positions begin to liquidate . Circle to support SOL for wallets. 4% of Turkey GDP used to buy stablecoins. QuantMatter say $11m stolen from OKX account. Biden to use Coinbase for crypto donations. Terraform Labs & Do Kwon set to pay $4.5bn fine. Franklin Templeton write report on SOL DePin. TON flips ETH for active addresses. Moonpay & Paypal integration goes live in EU & UK.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 136 - FIRST MOTHER, NOW DADDY?
entry.summary: BTC ETFs see another $200m outflows. Another $190m of liquidations in volatility. $1.2bn BTC leaves exchanges in a day. ETF flows largely driven by basis trades: Pal. ‚ÄòPerfect setup‚Äô for longs into macro news today. ETH ETF approvals ‚Äòexpected this month‚Äô. Crypto in best place it has ever been: Circle CEO. China‚Äôs ICBC calls ETH ‚Äòdigital oil‚Äô. Trump wants ‚Äòmade in the USA‚Äô BTC. Crypto hacks $19bn since 2011. Symbiotic restaking protocol sees $150m inflows. Polygon launches $720m grants program. ZKsync accused of insider allocations. CRV drop leaves $90m loans at risk.

entry.title: Has AI Already Changed Gaming Forever?
entry.summary: Decrypt‚Äôs Sander Lutz and Rug Radio creator Puke sat down with Simon Davis of Mighty Bear Games and VC Kyle Klemmer to discuss how AI has already remade the gaming industry‚Äîfor better and for worse.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 135 - BTC FALLS ON OUTFLOWS
entry.summary: Crypto falls as ETFs see first outflow in 19 days. Short positions grow on downwards move in BTC. BTC short-term realised price now at $64k. ETH ETF issuers still waiting for SEC response. UK ETNs continue to see tiny volume. SOL validators get kicked out for sandwich attacks. ZKsync airdrop happening next week. ZKsync to give 17.8% to the community. OP launches Fraud Proofs. Bitfarms plans poison pill to counter takeover bid. OKX sees outflows after security incidents. Bybit considers shutting China offices. COIN may get added to S&P500.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 134 - EU SNAP ELECTIONS LAND
entry.summary: Volatility remains low, TL continues to be divisive. 2nd highest weekly close ever for BTC. Crypto funds saw $2bn inflows last week. Rumour that BlackRock will apply for SOL ETF. Base TVL hits $8bn, top of L2s for activity. zk Sync hint at TGE this week. PENDLE enters top 5 for DeFi TVL. Berachain v2 testnet goes live.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 133 - RUGGED BY HOGEN?
entry.summary: BTC still just below ATH after $218m ETF inflows. BTC OI hits record $37bn as long-short ratio rises. Amount of ETH on exchanges lowest since 2015. Franklin Templeton explores broader crypto fund. Mining stocks rise on takeover frenzy. Kraken considers $100m funding round. Binance reinstates crypto buys with Mastercard. Phantom & Jito partner for native staking.
